thread.title: Rumour Mill: Premier League play for $160m Messi
thread.title_full: Rumour Mill: Premier League play for $160m Messi

title: Rumour Mill: Premier League play for $160m Messi
text:
Rumour Mill: City line up Messi move, Lindelof to United in summer, Wenger wants to stay February 19, 2017 1:38pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS MANCHESTER City eye a move for Lionel Messi, Victor Lindelof is set to join Manchester United, and Arsene Wenger admits he wants to stay at Arsenal. 
Here’s the latest transfer links in Rumour Mill! 
CITY LINE UP MOVE FOR MESSI 
Manchester City have made Lionel Messi their number one target as they believe the £100 million-rated ($160m) Argentinian superstar is ready to leave Barcelona, according to The Mirror. 
Messi’s father and adviser, Jorge, is in Barca but reportedly not to talk to the Catalan giant about extending Messi’s current contract, which has 16 months left to run. 
As the club has given new deals to Neymar and Luis Suarez, Barca will reportedly struggle to increase Messi’s current wages while staying within La Liga salary restrictions. 
Spanish clubs can not spend more than 70 of their income on wages, and Messi is on £20 million-a-year after tax. Barcelona's Lionel Messi. Source: AP 
After the 4-0 drubbing by PSG in the Champions League, Pep Guardiola and City will have new optimism that Messi could seek a new club on a basic wage of £500,000-a-week. 
Reports in Spain detail that Messi is keen to reunite with his old manager, but the Spaniard has ruled out returning to the Barcelona head role to potentially take over from under pressure-Enrique. 
“No, I will never go back to Barcelona to be coach there. My period there is gone,” said Guardiola, who won 14 trophies in four years. 
Instead, City are now reportedly expecting Guardiola to stay beyond 2019. 
Athletic Bilbao coach Ernesto Valverde is reportedly a contender for the job if Enrique leaves, along with Eusebio Sacristan of Real Sociedad and Everton’s Ronald Koeman , who as a player scored the goal that secured them their first European Cup in 1992. 
But according to Express, Barca still want Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino to become their new manager. Tottenham Hotspur's coach Mauricio Pochettino. Source: AFP 
LINDELOF TO JOIN UNITED, JOSE SET FOR NEW DEAL: REPORTS 
Manchester United have agreed a deal to sign Benfica defender Victor Lindelof (rated at £38m, $62m) this summer, even though Roma attempted to derail the deal, according to Tuttomercatoweb. 
Lindelof was linked with a move to Old Trafford in January but remained in Lisbon. 
Now, it’s being reported the Red Devils have signed a pre-contract agreement with the Swede as he’s set to arrive before next season. 
It will come as a blow to Roma as the defender was reportedly a target to replace Kostas Manolas, who’s set to leave at the end of this campaign. Benfica's Luisao and Victor Lindelof jumps for the ball. Source: AP 
But Jose Mourinho , who is set to be offered a new five-year deal this summer according to The Sun , is considering a move for Arsenal’s Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain in a £30 million move, according to The Mirror. 
Despite impressing during his Gunners career, the 23-year-old has scored just three times in the last two seasons, but Mourinho reportedly believes he will fit into his United system. 
However, it seems Luke Shaw’ s career at Old Trafford isn’t in danger as the manager will give him a full chance to prove his long-term worth to the club, according to The Mail. Arsenal's midfielder Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain. Source: AFP 
WENGER: I’D PREFER TO STAY AT ARSENAL 
Arsene Wenger has revealed he wants to stay in football management long-term and has indicated for the first time he would like to extend his spell as Arsenal’s manager. 
The Frenchman’s future is up in the air, with his contract expiring at the end of the season and events on the pitch exposing him to criticism from supporters. 
Wenger said earlier this week he intends to continue working as a manager even if his 21-year reign at the Emirates Stadium comes to an end, but he says his preference would be to remain at Arsenal. 
When asked about his future in the game, the 67-year-old told reporters: “If you have a team, maybe you can employ me. 
“That’s not a threat. My preference is always to manage Arsenal. I think I have shown that. But I am adult enough to analyse the situation.” Arsenal's French headcoach Arsene Wenger. Source: AFP 
Wenger’s latest low came last Wednesday when Arsenal were crushed 5-1 at Bayern Munich in the Champions League, leaving them on the brink of a seventh successive last-16 exit. 
They are also 10 points below leaders Chelsea in the Premier League. But Wenger believes he still has at least four years left in his managerial career and wants to work for longer than Manchester United’s Alex Ferguson, who was 71 when he retired in 2013. 
“Ferguson has some other interests in life,” he said. 
“He was older than I am today. He was four years older and retired at 71. I’m 67. Maybe (I’ll manage for) more, or maybe less. I don’t know. Everyone is different. 
“I do not want to take anything away from Ferguson. He was an unbelievable manager, but had enough. I’m not at that stage.” Wenger hints at exit 1:10 
LEICESTER EYE NEXT VARDY 
In a bid to unearth the next Jamie Vardy, Leicester have given a trial to non-league striker Josh Gordon after scoring 10 goals in 16 games. 
The 22-year-old will train with the Premier League champions next week after impressing the Foxes while playing for Stafford Ragners in the Evo-Stick Premier Division. 
Derby are also reportedly tracking Gordon, but Leicester have made the first move. 
Leicester bought Vardy, who scored 24 goals last season to take them to the title, from Fleetwood for £1m in 2012. 3rd-tier Millwall shock Foxes 1:02 
BITES 
- Liverpool have entered talks to sign out-of-favour Borussia Dortmund midfielder Mario Gotze , according to The Mirror. 
- James Rodriguez claims his future is at Real Madrid despite a lack of playing time. 
- Former Chelsea player Michael Essien is set to sign for Croatian side HNK Rijeka, according to Radio Rijeka. 
- Additional reporting from AFP.
